oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fruit painting, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One page from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. The fruit painting on this page was painted by Eichbaum's wife, Catherine Stearns. Stearns was a teacher at the Nashville Female Academy. The painting was found loose inside the bound volume of Eichbaum's sketches. Forms part of the Eichbaum Sketchbook Collection. 1 painting : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eichbaum, William A., 1787-1873--Notebooks, sketchbooks, etc.
